p: Globularia alypum L. was collected from Taza region in Morocco, in the spring season between March and April 2018; plant identification was carried by Professor Mohamed El Kadiri, a botanist of the Abd Al-Malek Essaadi University (Tetouan, Morocco) and deposited in the herbarium of the Faculty with a voucher specimen code GA-LABP01. The fresh leaves of G. A. were dried on air at room temperature in shade approximately for 2 weeks. Once the leaves were well dried, they were powdered and stocked in glass bottle in the dark for further analyses.
